analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong zhes bya bar 'du shes na /

analyzed: chags pa yin no //

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo sems dang po bskyed phyin chad dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /

original: chags pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa yin no //
translated: they are attached.

analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na /

original: chags pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa yin no //
translated: they are attached.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par @105a *//

analyzed: spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la spyod na /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path,

original: chags pa yin no //
analyzed: chags pa yin no //
translated: they are attached.

original: chags pa yin no /
analyzed: chags pa yin no /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: gang yang khyod 'di skad du /

analyzed: 'di snyam du /

analyzed: gzugs kyis gzugs kun tu mi shes so //

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pas rnam par shes pa kun tu mi shes so //

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kyis da ltar byung ba'i chos rnams kun tu mi shes so //
translated: Present phenomena do not know present phenomena.

original: snyam du mi sems so //
analyzed: snyam du mi sems so //
translated: They do not think like that.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems chen po thabs la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems chen po thabs la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /
translated: bodhisattva great beings skilled in means practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid @105b dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid @105b dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: do not think, ‘I will train in inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: emptiness of the unconditioned, emptiness of the extreme, emptiness of what is beginningless and endless, emptiness of what is not to be discarded, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di snyam du /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir 'di snyam du /
translated: emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, emptiness of nonobservation, emptiness of nonentities, emptiness of essential nature, and emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities.

original: bdag gis sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o //🔽'di la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o // 'di la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: “For these reasons, I should give gifts.🔽I should give to this one.

original: 'di sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di sbyin par bya'o //
translated: I should give this.🔽”

original: zhe'am / de bzhin du bdag gis tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bsgom bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhe'am / de bzhin du bdag gis tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab bsgom bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, “I should cultivate morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.

original: shes rab 'di bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'di bsgom par bya'o //
translated: I should cultivate wisdom.

original: shes rab 'di ltar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab 'di ltar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: “I will cultivate wisdom,”

original: zhe'am / bdag gis bsod nams spel bar byed pa'o //🔽bsod nams 'di spel bar bya'o //🔽bsod nams 'di ltar spel bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhe'am / bdag gis bsod nams spel bar byed pa'o // bsod nams 'di spel bar bya'o // bsod nams 'di ltar spel bar bya'o //
translated: “I will increase my merit,”🔽“I will increase this merit,”

original: zhe'am / bdag ni /
analyzed: zhe'am / bdag ni /
translated: “I will increase this merit in this way,”

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: “I will enter into the faultlessness of the bodhisattvas,”

original: bdag ni / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed pa'o //
translated: “I will purify a buddhafield,”

original: bdag ni / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: “I will bring beings to maturity,”

original: bdag ni / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed pa'o //🔽snyam du mi sems te /
analyzed: bdag ni / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rjes su thob par byed pa'o // snyam du mi sems te /
translated: “I will attain the knowledge of all aspects,”🔽“I will turn the wheel of the Dharma,”🔽“I will enter into complete nirvāṇa,”🔽“I will establish beings in the three vehicles.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems @106a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems @106a *//
translated: the bodhisattva great beings

original: dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag la ni /
analyzed: dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag la ni /
translated: who are skilled in means and practice the perfection of wisdom

original: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa dag med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa dag med do //
translated: do not have such conceptual thoughts.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: they do not have

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i ma chags pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs la mkhas pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i ma chags pa yin no //
translated: “Kauśika, it is because the bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom with skillful means are unattached.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, asked venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,

original: rnam grangs gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chags par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: rnam grangs gang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chags par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: by what method do bodhisattva great beings become attached?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpas sems su kun tu shes pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab tu kun tu shes pa dang / nang stong pa nyid du kun tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpas sems su kun tu shes pa dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab tu kun tu shes pa dang / nang stong pa nyid du kun tu shes pa dang /
translated: here bodhisattvas cognize mind, cognize generosity, moral discipline, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, cognize inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du kun tu shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su kun tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du kun tu shes pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams su kun tu shes pa dang /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su kun tu shes pa dang / sangs rgyas las bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams su kun tu shes pa de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus te brtul cing gzhal nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa de ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams su kun tu shes pa dang / sangs rgyas las bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams su kun tu shes pa de dag thams cad mngon par bsdus te brtul cing gzhal nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa de ni /
translated: and the bhagavān buddhas, and the wholesome roots produced by the buddhas, and dedicates all that to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening after completely gathering it, collecting it, and measuring it,

original: @106b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chags pa ste /
analyzed: @106b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chags pa ste /
translated: that is the bodhisattva great beings’ attachment.

original: des ni / chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: des ni / chags pa med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod par mi nus so //
translated: Because of that they are not able to practice the perfection of wisdom without attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ltar / gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gzugs kyi rang bzhin ni /
translated: The nature of form

original: yongs su bsngo bar mi nus la /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo bar mi nus la /
translated: cannot be dedicated.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yang yongs su bsngo bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin yang yongs su bsngo bar mi nus shing /
translated: the nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness also cannot be dedicated.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin yang yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin yang yongs su bsngo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, up to the nature of the knowledge of all aspects also cannot be dedicated.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du gzhan dag la ston par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i yid kyis yang dag par bstan par bya /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya /
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi don du gzhan dag la ston par 'dod pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i yid kyis yang dag par bstan par bya / yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya /
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings who want to teach others and want to cause others to take up unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening should teach them with a mind that has realized the real nature.🔽They should cause them to take it up.

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya /
translated: They should encourage them.

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya zhing /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya zhing /
translated: and should be made to rejoice.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When practicing the perfection of generosity,

original: ci nas kyang bdag ni /
analyzed: ci nas kyang bdag ni /
translated: they should be taught in such a way that they will not think,

original: sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o //
translated: ‘I am practicing generosity.

original: bdag ni / tshul khrims srung ba'o //🔽bdag ni / bzod pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / tshul khrims srung ba'o // bdag ni / bzod pa sgom pa'o //
translated: I am guarding morality.🔽I am cultivating patience.

original: bdag ni / brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / brtson 'grus rtsom pa'o //
translated: I am undertaking perseverance.

original: bdag ni / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: I am becoming absorbed in concentration.

original: bdag ni / shes rab sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / shes rab sgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating wisdom.

original: bdag ni / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa'o //🔽bdag ni / dngos po med pa'i @107a *//
analyzed: bdag ni / nang stong pa nyid la spyod pa'o // bdag ni / dngos po med pa'i @107a *//
translated: I am practicing inner emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod pa'o //
translated: I am practicing up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: bdag ni / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gsum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos gsum cu rtsa bdun sgom pa'o //
translated: I am cultivating the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: bdag ni / byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni / byang chub kyi phyir spyod pa'o //
translated: I am practicing for awakening.’

original: snyam du rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba de ltar yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam du rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ba de ltar yang dag par bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom should train by not apprehending anything.”🔽“Lord, how should bodhisattva great beings train in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar gzhan dag la yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang de ltar gzhan dag la yang dag par ston pa dang / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang / yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa de ni /
translated: who causes them to rejoice,

original: bdag kyang nyams par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag kyang nyams par mi 'gyur la /
translated: will not be lost himself,

original: de dag la'ang sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pas yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la'ang sangs rgyas kyis gnang ba'i yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pas yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: and he will cause them to take it up by causing them to take up the Dharma as it has been blessed by the Buddha.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de la ltar gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de la ltar gzhan dag la yang dag par bstan par bya /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should teach this to others,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug par bya / yang dag par gzengs bstod par bya /
translated: should cause them to take it up,🔽should cause them to rejoice,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya ste /
translated: and should cause them to take it up.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: those sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis de ltar chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis de ltar chags pa'i mtha' thams cad yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: daughters of a good family should completely abandon all those extremes of attachment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / gang khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa'i mtha' de dag bstan pa legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / gang khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa'i mtha' de dag bstan pa legs so //
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Subhuti:

original: legs so // @107b rab 'byor /
analyzed: legs so // @107b rab 'byor /
translated: Subhuti, it is good that you have taught the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, the limits of their attachment.

original: chags pa'i rnam pa de bas kyang phra ba gzhan dag kyang khyod la bstan par bya'i /
analyzed: chags pa'i rnam pa de bas kyang phra ba gzhan dag kyang khyod la bstan par bya'i /
translated: Subhuti, I will teach you other, more subtle, aspects of attachment.

original: de dag legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //🔽tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de dag legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Listen well and bear them in mind, and I will tell you.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The venerable Subhuti said:

original: de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin no //
translated: So be it, Lord.

original: zhes gsol te bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: zhes gsol te bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: And he listened as the Lord had directed. The Lord said:

original: rab 'byor / 'di la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la yang dag par zhugs pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Subhuti, here a son or daughter of good family who has set out for full enlightenment, having stood in the perfection of wisdom, should investigate thus:

original: rigs kyi bu mo dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan mar yid la byed na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan mar yid la byed na /
translated: “If sons and daughters of good family take the Tathāgata as an object of mental activity through signs,

original: rab 'byor / ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa yin no //🔽gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa yin no // gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi thugs dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas shing /
translated: to that extent, Subhūti, they are attached.🔽“Moreover, they take as an object of mental activity through signs all the wholesome roots of those tathāgatas, starting from when they first produced the thought, up to when they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas ji srid du dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad mtshan mar yid la byed cing /
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas ji srid du dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i bar de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad mtshan mar yid la byed cing /
translated: up to when they fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, up to when they passed into complete nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without any aggregates left behind, and up to the end of the continuity of the good Dharma,

original: yid la byas nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
analyzed: yid la byas nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
translated: and having taken them as an object of mental activity through signs, they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa yin no //
translated: “Subhūti, to the extent that there is attention to signs, to that extent there is attachment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa thams cad dang bral ba @108a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chags pa thams cad dang bral ba @108a *//
translated: The roots of virtue of the Tathāgatas, who are free from all attachment,

original: rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de dag dang / de las gzhan pa sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang mtshan mar yid la byas nas bla na med yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
analyzed: rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa de dag dang / de las gzhan pa sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang mtshan mar yid la byas nas bla na med yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed na /
translated: and the roots of virtue of other sentient beings, if they are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening with attention to signs,

original: rab 'byor / ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji tsam du mtshan mar yid la byed pa de tsam du chags pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, to the extent that there is attention to signs, to that extent there is attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, the Tathāgatas

original: mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin la /
translated: are not to be attended to with signs.🔽The roots of virtue of other sentient beings are also not to be attended to with signs.”🔽“Lord, if the roots of virtue of the Tathāgatas, who are free from all attachment,

original: de dag las gzhan pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kyang mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag kyang mtshan mar yid la bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Similarly, if they do not practice the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the factors of awakening, the powers,

translated: If they do not engage with the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to or the knowledge of all aspects,

analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar mi spyod na /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //

translated: If they do not engage with ‘form is happiness’ or ‘form is suffering,’ ‘form is a self’ or ‘form is not a self,’ ‘form is attractive’ or ‘form is unattractive,’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they are practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //

analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: “Moreover, Su­bhūti, when great bodhisattva beings who practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom do not engage with the notion that physical forms are perfect or that they are imperfect,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su rdzogs pa'am /

analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: Similarly, when they do not engage with the notions that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are perfect or that they are imperfect,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

translated: then that is not consciousness.🔽If one does not engage in the idea that it is complete or incomplete,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin zhing /
translated: then one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
translated: Likewise, up to the knowledge of all aspects is perfected.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa gang yin pa de /
translated: In the same way, up to the knowledge of all aspects, whether complete or incomplete,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ma yin no //
translated: is not the knowledge of all aspects.

original: zhes bya ba de ltar yang mi spyod na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de ltar yang mi spyod na /
translated: If one does not practice in that way,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: The Lord having said that,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,🔽the Lord’s good statement to bodhisattva great beings

original: 'di ltar chags pa dang / chags pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de dag /
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa dang / chags pa ma mchis pa gang lags pa de dag /
translated: of the attachment and nonattachment

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la legs par gsungs pa ni; ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la legs par gsungs pa ni; ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: is amazing.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: The Lord said,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so, it is so.🔽It is just as you have said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs @111a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs @111a *//
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,🔽

original: ba'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa dang / ma chags pa dag legs par bshad do //
analyzed: ba'i sangs rgyas kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la chags pa dang / ma chags pa dag legs par bshad do //
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha has explained well to the bodhisattva great beings the attachments and the non-attachments.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe gzugs chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom do not practice ‘form is not attached,’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: When they do not practice ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not attached,’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: mig chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: mig chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: When they do not practice ‘the eyes are not attached,’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: Similarly, if one does not practice with the idea that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are unattached,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: If one does not practice with the idea that the perfection of generosity is unattached,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: Similarly, if one does not practice with the idea that the perfections of moral discipline, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are unattached,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: one is practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams @111b dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams @111b dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid chags pa med pa zhes bya bar mi spyod na /
translated: Similarly, if they do not engage with the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects being called ‘unattached,’

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar spyod pa ni /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing like that

original: gzugs chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: do not have the notion that form is called ‘unattached.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: They do not have the notion that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is called ‘unattached.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //
translated: They do not have the notion that up to the knowledge of all aspects is called ‘unattached.’

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do ////🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chags pa med pa zhes bya bar 'du shes pa med do //// shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
translated: Chapter : The Perfection of Wisdom

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord!🔽It is amazing

original: 'di ltar chos bstan pa zab mo 'di bshad kyang 'phel ba ma mchis la /🔽ma bshad kyang 'grib pa ma mchis pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos bstan pa zab mo 'di bshad kyang 'phel ba ma mchis la / ma bshad kyang 'grib pa ma mchis pa de ni /
translated: that this profound Dharma teaching is explained without increase

original: ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: and without decrease, whether it is taught or not taught.🔽”🔽The Lord said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //
translated: Subhūti, it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @112a *//🔽ni; bshad kyang 'phel ba med la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @112a *// ni; bshad kyang 'phel ba med la /
translated: The perfection of wisdom🔽does not increase when explained,

original: ma bshad kyang 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: ma bshad kyang 'grib pa med do //
translated: and it does not decrease when not explained.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs shing nam mkha'i bsngags pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par gyur kyang nam mkha' la ni /🔽bsngags ba brjod kyang 'phel ba med la /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bzhugs shing nam mkha'i bsngags pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par gyur kyang nam mkha' la ni / bsngags ba brjod kyang 'phel ba med la /
translated: For example, even if the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One were to remain for the duration of his life and speak in praise of space and in dispraise of space,🔽space would not increase

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang 'grib pa med de /
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang 'grib pa med de /
translated: when praised, and it would not decrease when disparaged.

original: nam mkha' ni /🔽bsngags kyang 'phel ba med la /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni / bsngags kyang 'phel ba med la /
translated: Space🔽does not increase when praised,

original: ma bsngags kyang 'grib pa med do //
analyzed: ma bsngags kyang 'grib pa med do //
translated: and it does not decrease when not praised.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:🔽For example, even if one were to speak in praise of an illusory person

original: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu la ni /🔽bsngags pa brjod kyang 'phel ba med la /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma'i skyes bu la ni / bsngags pa brjod kyang 'phel ba med la /
translated: and in dispraise of an illusory person,🔽the illusory person would not increase when praised,

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang 'grib pa med de /
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang 'grib pa med de /
translated: and it would not decrease when disparaged.

original: bsngags pa brjod kyang rjes su chags pa med /
analyzed: bsngags pa brjod kyang rjes su chags pa med /
translated: and even if praised, they are not attached.

original: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang khong khro ba med do //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de'ang bshad kyang de bzhin la /
analyzed: bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod kyang khong khro ba med do // rab 'byor / de bzhin du chos rnams kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de'ang bshad kyang de bzhin la /
translated: And even if disparaged, they are not angry.

original: ma bshad kyang de bzhin no //🔽rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: ma bshad kyang de bzhin no // rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, the true nature of dharmas is just as it is whether it is explained or not.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa na /
translated: “Subhūti, those bodhisattva great beings who practice the perfection of wisdom, who cultivate the perfection of wisdom,

original: zhum par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhum par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: will not be disheartened.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las kyang slar mi ldog pa de dag ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las kyang slar mi ldog pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who practice yoga in this perfection of wisdom and do not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening

original: dka' ba bgyid pa lags so //
analyzed: dka' ba bgyid pa lags so //
translated: are doing what is difficult.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgom pa de ni /
translated: This cultivation of the perfection of wisdom

original: nam mkha' sgom @112b pa lags te /
analyzed: nam mkha' sgom @112b pa lags te /
translated: is the cultivation of space.

original: nam mkha' la ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni /
translated: In space

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma mchis /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma mchis /
translated: there is no perfection of wisdom,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: no perfection of concentration, no perfection of perseverance, no perfection of patience, no perfection of morality, and no perfection of generosity.

original: nam mkha' la ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni /
translated: In space

original: gzugs kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: gzugs kyang ma mchis /
translated: there is no form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang ma mchis /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang ma mchis /
translated: no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness.

original: nam mkha' la ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni /
translated: In space🔽there is no emptiness,🔽up to there is no markless,🔽there is no wishless,🔽there is no conditioned, and there is no unconditioned.🔽In space

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang ma mchis /
translated: there is no inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang ma mchis /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang ma mchis /
translated: up to there is no emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: nam mkha' la ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni /
translated: In space

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyang ma mchis /
translated: there is no perfection of giving,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams kyang ma mchis /
translated: and the path do not exist.

original: nam mkha' la ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni /
translated: In space,🔽the ten powers,🔽the fearlessnesses,🔽the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang ma mchis /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha do not exist.

original: nam mkha' la ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni /
translated: In space,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma mchis /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ma mchis /
translated: the result of stream enterer does not exist.

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang ma mchis /
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyang ma mchis /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang ma mchis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: Even unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening does not exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni /

analyzed: nam mkha'i slad du brtson par 'tshal ba dang / 'bad par 'tshal ba dang / rtsol bar 'tshal ba lags so //

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽gang dag sems can rnams kyi @113a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / gang dag sems can rnams kyi @113a *//

original: slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni /

analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su grol bar 'tshal ba lags so //
translated: are seeking to liberate space.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis nam mkha' lta bu'i chos thams cad kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag gis nam mkha' lta bu'i chos thams cad kyi slad du go cha 'tshal ba de dag ni /
translated: those bodhisattva great beings who don the armor for the sake of all phenomena, which are like space,

original: go cha chen po 'tshal ba lags so //
analyzed: go cha chen po 'tshal ba lags so //

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽those who don the great armor for the sake of sentient beings

analyzed: gang dag gis sems can rnams kyi slad du go cha chen po 'tshal ba de dag ni; nam mkha' bar snang la gdeg par 'tshal ba lags so //
translated: are seeking to lift space into the sky.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag sems can rnams kyi slad du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'tshal ba de dag ni /

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa lags te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa lags te /
translated: have attained the perfection of diligence.

original: bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /

analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du yid la bgyid pa de la bdag gis bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang /

analyzed: sba ba ji lta bu zhig bgyi lags /

original: rab 'byor @114b gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor @114b gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /

analyzed: 'di nyid de la srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed par 'gyur ro //

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /

translated: Can you protect, guard, and conceal illusions, mirages, dreams, echoes, and optical illusions?”🔽Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de bzhin du gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag la bsrung pa dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya bar sems pa de'ang 'di ltar mi 'grub pa dang / ngal ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa dag la bsrung pa dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya bar sems pa de'ang 'di ltar mi 'grub pa dang / ngal ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: Similarly, anyone who thinks to protect, guard, and conceal the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom will end up with nothing to show for it and will be exhausted.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /

analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /

analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa bdag la bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang / sba bar bya bar sems pa de'ang 'di ltar mi 'grub pa dang / ngal ba'i skal ba can du 'gyur bar zad do //

analyzed: ji tsam gyis na /

original: rmi lam gyi mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed cing /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed cing /

analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ga lte gzugs rlom sems su mi byed /

analyzed: gzugs bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /

original: rmi lam bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rmi lam bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /

original: sprul pa bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /

original: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project emanations,

original: sprul pa'i mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed pa yin no //
translated: nor do they falsely project the signs of emanations.

analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rlom sems su mi byed /

original: rnam par shes pa bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: nor do they falsely project ‘consciousness is mine.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project , up to and including omniscience;

analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi @116a *//

original: rmi lam rlom sems su mi byed; rmi lam bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /

original: rmi lam la rlom sems su mi byed /🔽rmi lam gyi mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed cing /

original: sprul pa'i bar du rlom sems su mi byed /

original: sprul pa bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed /🔽sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: sprul pa bdag gi zhes bya bar rlom sems su mi byed / sprul pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They do not falsely project ‘emanations are mine.’🔽They do not falsely project emanations.

original: sprul pa'i mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i mtshan mar yang rlom sems su mi byed pa yin no //
translated: They do not falsely project the causal signs of emanations.

original: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang /
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang /
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s power, all the gods of the desire realm, from the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm, the gods of the Yāma realm, the gods of the Tuṣita realm, the gods of the Nirmāṇa­rata realm, the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm,

original: tshangs ris dang; tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed 'khod pa de dag thams cad lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma dag thogs te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su mngon par 'thor zhing /
analyzed: tshangs ris dang; tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don dang / tshangs 'khor dang / gnas gtsang ma'i rigs kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang ji snyed 'khod pa de dag thams cad lha'i tsandan gyi phye ma dag thogs te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su mngon par 'thor zhing /
translated: the gods of the Brahmakāyika realm, the gods of the Brahmapurohita realm, the gods of the Brahmapārṣadya realm, and the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm, who were present in this great trichiliocosm, took up divine sandalwood powder and scattered it over the Blessed One.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyis shar phyogs na sangs rgyas stong @116b rnam pa 'di dag nyid dang /🔽ming 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der dong ste lhags nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'khod do; ;de nas sangs rgyas kyi mthus rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyis shar phyogs na sangs rgyas stong @116b rnam pa 'di dag nyid dang / ming 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston cing /
translated: Then, through the Buddha’s might, the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm thought, “In the east there are a thousand Buddhas, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, who with these same words, these same letters, these same phonemes, are teaching this very perfection of wisdom, this very chapter on the perfection of wisdom,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dag bsam bar gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dag bsam bar gyur to //
translated: and through the Buddha’s might, they are being asked about the perfection of wisdom by monks named Subhūti, and they are being asked about this very chapter on the perfection of wisdom by Śakra, Lord of the Gods, and by the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm.”

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams kun na'ang sangs rgyas stong stong rnam pa 'di dag nyid dang / ming 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / 'og dang / steng dang / phyogs mtshams kun na'ang sangs rgyas stong stong rnam pa 'di dag nyid dang / ming 'di dag nyid kyis chos ston cing /
translated: In the same way, in the south, west, north, below, above, and in all the intermediate directions, a thousand buddhas, with these very aspects, these very names, are teaching the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi mthus dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dag bsam par gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mthus dge slong rab 'byor ces bya ba sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin sha stag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid yongs su zhu ba dag bsam par gyur to //
translated: And by the power of the Buddha, the monk Subhūti, with the very same name, is asking about the perfection of wisdom, and the very same chapter on the perfection of wisdom, and the lord of the gods Śakra is asking about the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:🔽Subhūti, do you see this many bodhisattva great beings assembled and gathered in this great assembly?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sa phyogs 'di nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro //🔽gang dag bskal pa bzang po 'di la 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @117a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang sa phyogs 'di nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro // gang dag bskal pa bzang po 'di la 'byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @117a *//
translated: “Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, will teach this perfection of wisdom in this very place.

original: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sa phyogs 'di nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sa phyogs 'di nyid du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas who will appear in this good eon, having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, will teach this perfection of wisdom in this very place.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston par 'gyur ba lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas rnam pa gang dag dang / rtags gang dag dang / mtshan ma gang dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ston par 'gyur ba lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Venerable Lord, when the bodhisattva great being Maitreya has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, by means of what aspects, indications, and attributes will he teach this transcendent perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gzugs rtag ces bya ba'am /
translated: The Blessed One replied, “Su­bhūti, when the bodhisattva great being Maitreya has attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, he will not teach the sacred doctrine that physical forms are permanent,

original: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or that they are impermanent.

original: de bzhin du gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / gzugs sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / gzugs bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / gzugs sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is happiness’ or ‘Form is suffering.’ He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is a self’ or ‘Form is not a self.’ He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is attractive’ or ‘Form is unattractive.’

original: gzugs bcings zhes bya ba dang / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs bcings zhes bya ba dang / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is bound’ or ‘Form is liberated.’

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du @117b shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du @117b shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Similarly, he will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are permanent’ or ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are impermanent.’ He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Consciousness is happiness’ or ‘Consciousness is suffering.’

original: rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / rnam par shes pa sdug ces bya ba dang / mi sdug ces bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Consciousness is a self’ or ‘Consciousness is not a self.’ He will not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Consciousness is attractive’ or ‘Consciousness is unattractive.’

original: rnam par shes pa bcings zhes bya ba dang / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bcings zhes bya ba dang / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nor would he teach the Dharma saying, ‘Consciousness is bound’ or ‘Consciousness is freed.’

original: gzugs 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Form is past, future, or present.’

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is past, future, or present.’

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘Up to the knowledge of all aspects is past, future, or present.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bcings zhes bya ba dang / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bcings zhes bya ba dang / grol zhes bya bar chos ston par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He would not teach the Dharma saying, ‘The knowledge of all aspects is bound’ or ‘The knowledge of all aspects is freed.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then venerable Subhūti said to the Lord:🔽“Lord, if the perfection of wisdom is not the perfection of wisdom in such a way, and if it is not the perfection of wisdom in such a way, then how is it the perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord said, Subhuti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ji ltar chos ston par 'gyur lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas ji ltar chos ston par 'gyur lags /
translated: how will the Bodhisattva, the great being Maitreya, when he has fully known the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment, teach the Dharma?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said, Subhuti,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs @118a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs @118a *//
translated: form

original: shin tu rnam par dag go /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag go /
translated: is very pure.

original: zhes shin tu rnam par dag ba'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu rnam par dag go /
analyzed: zhes shin tu rnam par dag ba'i chos ston par 'gyur ro // de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa shin tu rnam par dag go /
translated: He will teach the Dharma in such a way that he will say, 'Form is very pure.'

original: zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //🔽de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag go /
analyzed: zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro // de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du shin tu rnam par dag go /
translated: Similarly, he will teach the Dharma in such a way that he will say, 'Feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are very pure.'

original: zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, he will teach the Dharma in such a way that he will say, 'Up to the knowledge of all modes is very pure.'

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhuti said, Lord,🔽how will the Bodhisattva, the great being Maitreya, when he has fully known the utmost, right, and perfect enlightenment, teach the Dharma?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom

original: yongs su dag pa lags so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa lags so //
translated: is pure.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs yongs su dag pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa yin no //
