translated: they have practiced the perfection of giving for many hundred thousand kotis of niyutas of kalpas,

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa yin no //🔽snyam mo // de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad pa yin no // snyam mo // de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: they have practiced the perfection of morality, patience, vigour, concentration, and wisdom.🔽Then the venerable Sariputra thought to himself:🔽The Lord has said that those who will take up this perfection of wisdom, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,🔽🔽

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: who will learn it, bear it in mind, preach, study and write it,🔽they will have fulfilled their duties under the former Jinas, etc.

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas mi skrag mi dngang zhing /🔽dngang bar mi 'gyur la /🔽'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du'ang brtson par bgyid pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di thos nas mi skrag mi dngang zhing / dngang bar mi 'gyur la / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa dang / tshul bzhin du'ang brtson par bgyid pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo dag ni /
translated: “Blessed One, those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who, on hearing this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, are not terrified, are not fearful, and do not become frightened,🔽and who hold, recite, master, and endeavor in the appropriate manner,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ji lta ba de ltar gzung bar bgyi lags so //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ji lta ba de ltar gzung bar bgyi lags so //
translated: those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage should be regarded in the same way as irreversible great bodhisattva beings.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bcom ldan @136b 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan @136b 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni /
translated: it is because this transcendent perfection of wisdom

original: zab lags te /
analyzed: zab lags te /
translated: is profound.

original: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag lam spyad pa dag gis ni /
analyzed: sngon pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag lam spyad pa dag gis ni /
translated: Those who have previously practiced the path of the six transcendent perfections

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par rngo mi thogs pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par rngo mi thogs pa'i slad du'o //
translated: are unable to aspire to this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: those sons of enlightened heritage

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spong bar sems pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spong bar sems pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis ni /
translated: “Son of a good family or daughter of a good family who thinks to reject this deep perfection of wisdom, those sons of a good family or daughters of a good family🔽

original: sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs pa lags so //
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spangs pa lags so //
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage who think to reject this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom have previously rejected this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽'di ltar / rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / 'di ltar / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Blessed One,🔽it is because those sons of enlightened heritage

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag ni /
translated: or daughters of enlightened heritage

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad pa ma mchis pa dang / dga' ba ma mchis pa dang / dang ba ma mchis pas /🔽rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la dad pa ma mchis pa dang / dga' ba ma mchis pa dang / dang ba ma mchis pas / rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: have no faith in this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom, have no joy in it, and have no confidence in it.

original: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la 'di skad du /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo de dag gis sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos rnams la 'di skad du / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la ni /
translated: Those sons of enlightened heritage or daughters of enlightened heritage have said to the buddhas and the buddhas’ śrāvakas,

original: ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar spyad par bgyi /
translated: ‘How should we practice the transcendent perfection of generosity?

original: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar spyod par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar spyod par bgyi /
translated: How should I cultivate

original: nang stong pa nyid la ni /🔽ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la ni / ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: inner emptiness,

original: phyi stong pa nyid la ni /🔽ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid la ni / ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: outer emptiness,

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid la ni /🔽ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid la ni / ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: inner and outer emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la ni /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la ni /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should I cultivate

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la ni /🔽ji ltar bsgom @137a *//
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la ni / ji ltar bsgom @137a *//
translated: the applications of mindfulness,🔽the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,

original: par bgyi / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la ni /
analyzed: par bgyi / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams la ni /
translated: the seven branches of enlightenment,🔽and the noble eightfold path?

original: ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: How should I cultivate

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la ni /🔽ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la ni /🔽ji ltar bsgom par bgyi /
translated: the ten tathāgata powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la ni /
translated: the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a Buddha.

original: ji ltar bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su zhu ba ma bgyis pa'i slad du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom par bgyi zhes yongs su zhu ba ma bgyis pa'i slad du'o //
translated: “Why is it that they do not ask the Lord about the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so; ;btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so; ;btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar ngo mtshar yang ci che ste /
analyzed: de ltar ngo mtshar yang ci che ste /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, what is so amazing about that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: This perfection of wisdom is very deep.

original: shin tu zab pas na /
analyzed: shin tu zab pas na /
translated: It is hard to fathom, hard to see, hard to understand,🔽and cannot be examined, cannot be analyzed, and cannot be comprehended.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par ma gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang sngon gyi mthar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di la mos par ma gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang /
translated: It is not something that can be known by those who are on the side of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, or by those who are on the side of the bodhisattvas, or by those who are on the side of the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas.

original: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos par ma gyur pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la mos par ma gyur pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mos par ma gyur pa dang /🔽byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mos par ma gyur pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par @137b shes pa lnga dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos par ma gyur pa dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spong bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mos par ma gyur pa dang / nang stong pa nyid la mos par ma gyur pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mos par ma gyur pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la mos par ma gyur pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par @137b shes pa lnga dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mos par ma gyur pa dag gis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di spong bar byed pa ni /
translated: They have no interest in the perfection of generosity, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom. They have no interest in inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.🔽They have no interest in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the five clairvoyances, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: ngo mtshar mi che'o //
analyzed: ngo mtshar mi che'o //
translated: It is not at all surprising that those who have no interest in this deep perfection of wisdom should reject it.

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni /
translated: those who pay homage to the perfection of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin pas na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin pas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bdag phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bdag phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Transcendent Conqueror, the perfection of wisdom.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Transcendent Conqueror said to Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: koo shi ka /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so.

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la phyag 'tshal ba de ni /
translated: Whoever pays homage to the perfection of wisdom

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes la phyag 'tshal ba yin no //
translated: pays homage to the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las nges par byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las nges par byung la /
translated: it is because the omniscience of the blessed buddhas also emerges from this perfection of wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis rab tu bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyis rab tu bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the perfection of wisdom is also generated by the exalted wisdom of omniscience.

original: koo shi ka /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: koo shi ka / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gnas par 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Kauśika,🔽sons of a good family or

original: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: daughters of a good family who want to stand in the knowledge of all aspects should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed par 'dod pa dang / bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa @138a *//🔽thams cad yang dag par 'joms par 'dod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes bskyed par 'dod pa dang / bag chags dang / mtshams sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa @138a *// thams cad yang dag par 'joms par 'dod pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'dod pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: Similarly, those who want to generate the exalted wisdom of the knowledge of all aspects, and who want to completely destroy all the latencies, connections, and afflictions,

original: rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: and who want to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and who want to turn the wheel of the Dharma, should also stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par 'dod pa dang / rang byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can rnams rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par 'dod pa dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par 'dod pa dang / rang byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa dang /
translated: in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, in the state of a worthy one, in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening,

original: sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun yongs su bsdu bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par 'dod pa dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun yongs su bsdu bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du bya'o //
translated: and in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and who want to gather a saṅgha of monks, should practice the perfection of wisdom.”

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / bcom ldan 'das la lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that, Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de /
translated: do bodhisattva great beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa lags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa lags /
translated: They abide in the perfection of wisdom.🔽

original: ji ltar na /🔽rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: ji ltar na / rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do they stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: How do they practice yoga?

original: bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha @138b rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa lags /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / brtson 'grus dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sbyin pa'i pha @138b rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa lags / ji ltar na /
translated: How do they stand in the perfections of concentration, perseverance, patience, morality, and giving?

original: rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /🔽ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
translated: How do they practice yoga?

original: nang stong pa nyid la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /🔽ji ltar na /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags / ji ltar na /
translated: How, when practicing the perfection of wisdom, do they practice yoga in inner emptiness?

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
translated: How do they practice yoga in up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature?

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
translated: how, when practicing the perfection of wisdom, do bodhisattva great beings practice yoga in the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening?

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad na /
translated: In the same way, how do Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rnal 'byor du bgyid pa lags /
translated: and engage in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the five clairvoyances, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha?

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;koo shi ka /
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to; ;koo shi ka /
translated: When this was said, the Lord said to Śatakratu, head of the gods, “Kauśika,

original: gang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don de yongs su zhu bar sems pa ni /
analyzed: gang khyod de bzhin gshegs pa la don de yongs su zhu bar sems pa ni /
translated: your thought to ask the Tathāgata about this topic

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: is good, good indeed!

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: khyod kyi spobs pa skyes pa de'ang sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin te; koo shi ka /
analyzed: khyod kyi spobs pa skyes pa de'ang sangs rgyas kyi mthu yin te; koo shi ka /
translated: your inspiration has arisen through the power of the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la yid la zungs shig dang / ngas khyod la bshad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, listen well and hard and pay attention, and I will tell you.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab @139a *//
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab @139a *//
translated: here bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gzugs la mi gnas te /
analyzed: kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa gzugs la mi gnas te /
translated: do not dwell on form.

original: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzugs la mi gnas pa de'i tshe gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: When they do not dwell on form, then they practice yoga on form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas te /
translated: Similarly, they do not dwell on feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa la rnal 'byor du byed pa yin no //
translated: When they do not dwell on consciousness, then they practice yoga on consciousness.

original: de bzhin du mig la mi gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la mi gnas /
translated: Similarly, they do not dwell on the eyes,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mi gnas te /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la mi gnas te /
translated: do not dwell on the ears, nose, tongue, body, or mind.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: Thus they practice yoga in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la mi gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la mi gnas /
translated: Similarly, they do not dwell on forms,

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la mi gnas te /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams la mi gnas te /
translated: do not dwell on sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, or dharmas.

original: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: Thus they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: Similarly, they practice the perfection of wisdom without abiding in the perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //🔽nang stong pa nyid la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do // nang stong pa nyid la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: Similarly, they practice the perfection of wisdom without abiding in the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom.🔽They practice the perfection of wisdom without abiding in inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du @139b byed do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du @139b byed do //
translated: They practice the perfection of wisdom without abiding in the emptiness of external things, the emptiness of both external and internal things, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: They do not stand in the applications of mindfulness, but practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: Similarly, they do not stand in the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, or the path, but practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshad med pa bzhi la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: They do not stand in the four immeasurables, but practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la mi gnas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la mi gnas /
translated: They do not stand in the four concentrations, the four formless absorptions, or the five superknowledges,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la mi gnas par shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: They practice yoga in the perfection of wisdom without standing in the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / gang la gnas pa dang / gang la rnal 'byor du byed pa'i gzugs de dmigs su med pa dang / de bzhin du gang la gnas pa dang / gang la rnal 'byor du byed pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gang la gnas pa dang / gang la rnal 'byor du byed pa'i gzugs de dmigs su med pa dang / de bzhin du gang la gnas pa dang / gang la rnal 'byor du byed pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang /
translated: It is because that form in which they would stand and in which they would practice yoga is not apprehended, and similarly, that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness in which they would stand and in which they would practice yoga is not apprehended.

original: rnam par shes pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang /
translated: Similarly, that constituents, that sense fields, that dependent origination, that perfections, that thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, that all emptinesses,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi @140a *//
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi @140a *//
translated: that ten powers, that four fearlessnesses, that four detailed and thorough knowledges, and that eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha in which they would stand and in which they would practice yoga is not apprehended.

original: 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-apprehensible.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: furthermore, bodhisattva great beings do not practice with form,

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed pa de ltar gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sbyor bar mi byed pa de ltar gzugs la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: and because they do not practice with form, they practice yoga with form.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: Similarly, they do not practice with feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa la sbyor bar mi byed pa de ltar rnam par shes pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa la sbyor bar mi byed pa de ltar rnam par shes pa la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: and because they do not practice with consciousness, they practice yoga with consciousness.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: Similarly, they do not apply themselves to the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, all the emptinesses, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sbyor bar mi byed pa de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rnal 'byor du byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la sbyor bar mi byed pa de ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la rnal 'byor du byed do //
translated: Because they do not apply themselves to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, they practice yoga in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gzugs sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'di ltar / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des gzugs sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs /
translated: It is because those bodhisattva great beings do not apprehend form in the past,

original: gzugs phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs /
analyzed: gzugs phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend form in the future,

original: @140b gzugs da ltar byung bar mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: @140b gzugs da ltar byung bar mi dmigs shing /
translated: Form is not apprehended in the present.

original: de bzhin du tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs /
analyzed: de bzhin du tsher ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not apprehended in the past,

original: rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs /
translated: consciousness is not apprehended in the future,

original: rnam par shes pa da ltar byung bar mi dmigs la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa da ltar byung bar mi dmigs la /
translated: and consciousness is not apprehended in the present.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, all the emptinesses, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs /🔽phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad sngon gyi mthar mi dmigs / phyi ma'i mthar mi dmigs /
translated: the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not apprehended in the past,🔽are not apprehended in the future,

original: da ltar byung bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung bar mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and are not apprehended in the present.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Lord:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: zab pa lags so //
analyzed: zab pa lags so //
translated: is profound.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” The Lord said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa yin no //
translated: because the suchness of form is profound, the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir /
translated: because the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is profound,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is profound.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / @141a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / @141a *//
translated: because the suchness of the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections,

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa yin no /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa'i de bzhin nyid zab pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab pa yin no /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is profound because of the profundity of all emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the correct understandings, and the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: gting dpag dka' ba lags so //
analyzed: gting dpag dka' ba lags so //
translated: is difficult to fathom.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: gzugs gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba yin no //
translated: the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom because form is difficult to fathom.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are difficult to fathom, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: similarly, because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gting dpag dka' ba yin no //
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are difficult to fathom, the perfection of wisdom is difficult to fathom.

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: shes rab kyi @141b pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi @141b pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: tshad ma mchis pa lags so //
analyzed: tshad ma mchis pa lags so //
translated: is immeasurable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin no; ;sh'a ri'i bu tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin no; ;sh'a ri'i bu tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin no //
translated: because form is immeasurable, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable. Śāriputra, because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are immeasurable, the perfection of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /

translated: similarly, because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams tshad med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa tshad med pa yin no //

original: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus gsol pa /
translated: Śāriputra said:

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gal te gzugs zab ces bya bar mi spyod na /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zab ces bya bar mi spyod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zab ces bya bar mi spyod na /

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa yin no //
translated: they practice the perfection of wisdom.

original: de @142a *// bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
